highlights.title: Should you downgrade to Google AI Plus?
highlights.description:
Google AI Plus came to the US this week as the more affordable alternative to AI Pro, which previously served as the entry point to premium Gemini features. Whether it’s worth downgrading comes down to how you use Google AI.
more…

highlights.title: The vast majority of Android Auto users still don’t seem to have Gemini
highlights.description:
Google announced the rollout of Gemini for Android Auto in November 2025 and, a couple of months later, it still doesn’t seem to be available for the majority of drivers.
more…

highlights.title: Amazon Fire TV is now blocking the installation of some sideloaded apps
highlights.description:
Amazon has been on a crusade to stop rampant piracy on Fire TV, with the company now blocking even the installation of certain sideloaded apps.
more…

highlights.title: Fitbit extends Google Account deadline to May 2026, with data deleted shortly after
highlights.description:
Under Google, Fitbit has been moving away from its traditional standalone accounts, instead pushing users to sign in with their Google account. That will be mandatory this year, but the deadline has been pushed back.
more…

highlights.title: Sales of the ultra-fast Xiaomi SU7 Ultra have ultra-plummeted to under 50 units
highlights.description:
The ultra-fast Xiaomi SU7 Ultra made enough headlines with its astonishing 0-60 sprints and record Nürburgring lap times to drum up around 3,000 sales per month – but the good times seem to have come to an end, and Xiaomi sold just 45 units in December.
more…

highlights.title: Report: humanoid robots set to drive demand for solid-state batteries
highlights.description:
Just how big is the market for humanoid robots? Big enough to soak up a whopping ~75 GWh of solid-state battery capacity between now and 2035 – nearly 1500x growth!
more…
